step_feedback.feedback: Great job starting in a comfortable position! Remember to place your hands on your abdomen to feel your breath.
Excellent! You're ready to begin inhaling. Keep your hands on your abdomen.
Nice slow inhale through your nose. Try to tighten your whole body muscles as you breathe in, imagining fluid moving to your chest.
Good exhale through your mouth. Focus on relaxing your muscles and visualizing pushing fluid out as you breathe out.
You're comfortably seated or standing. Keep your hands on your abdomen for this next breath.
Well done! Hands are in place. Prepare for your inhale.
Smooth inhale through your nose. Remember to engage all your body muscles and visualize the fluid moving towards your chest.
Great exhale! Relax your muscles and visualize expelling fluid as you breathe out through your mouth.

exercise_summary: You did a great job with the deep breathing exercise! Remember to inhale slowly through your nose, tightening your body, and exhale through your mouth, relaxing your muscles. This helps move lymph fluid effectively.
